title: How to Make Long Life Biscuits

steps.headline: Beat the margarine and sugar in a large bowl.
steps.description: You can beat manually or with an electric mixer. Mix until smooth.

steps.headline: Gradually add in the lemon rind and ginger.
steps.description: Mix together until all are well combined.

steps.headline: Add the milk and mix through.
steps.description:
Fold in the flour. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Take a heaped teaspoon of the mixture and roll into a ball.
steps.description:
Place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Repeat until all of the dough has been turned into balls. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Using the back of a fork, press down on each ball to flatten the biscuit slightly.
Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for about 15 minutes, or until the biscuits appear light golden brown.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
steps.description: Once completely cooled, these biscuits can be kept in the airtight container for a long time, as noted above. Enjoy your road trip or camping!

text:
Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Beat the margarine and sugar in a large bowl. You can beat manually or with an electric mixer. Mix until smooth. Gradually add in the lemon rind and ginger. Mix together until all are well combined. Add the milk and mix through. Fold in the flour. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Take a heaped teaspoon of the mixture and roll into a ball. Place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Repeat until all of the dough has been turned into balls. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cd\/Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Long-Life-Biscuits-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Using the back of a fork, press down on each ball to flatten the biscuit slightly. Place in the oven. Bake for about 15 minutes, or until the biscuits appear light golden brown. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Once completely cooled, these biscuits can be kept in the airtight container for a long time, as noted above. Enjoy your road trip or camping! Finished.
